content: Austrian footballer (born 2003) **Daniel Yuan Hao Au Yeong** (born 10 February 2003) is a [footballer](/wiki/Association_football) who plays as a [winger](/wiki/Forward_(association_football)) or [forward](/wiki/Forward_(association_football)) for [Austria Lustenau](/wiki/SC_Austria_Lustenau). He was born in the [Netherlands](/wiki/Netherlands) and has represented Austria at the youth level. ## Career ### Club career In 2019, Au Yeong joined the youth academy of German [Bundesliga](/wiki/Bundesliga) side [Freiburg](/wiki/SC_Freiburg). In 2022, he signed for [Austria Wien II](/wiki/FK_Austria_Wien) in Austria. On 12 August 2022, he debuted for [Austria Wien II](/wiki/FK_Austria_Wien) during a 2â€“3 loss to [Admira](/wiki/FC_Admira_Wacker_M%C3%B6dling). Au Yeong scored a goal for [Austria Wien II](/wiki/FK_Austria_Wien) against Grazer AK on 7 Oct 2022 and had an assist against SKU Amstetten on 21 Oct 2022. On 1 July 2024, Au Yeong signed for [Austria Lustenau](/wiki/SC_Austria_Lustenau). ### International career Au Yeong is eligible to represent [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team) internationally through his father. ## Personal life Au Yeong was born in the Netherlands to the former Singapore international footballer [Au-yeong Pak Kuan](/wiki/Au-yeong_Pak_Kuan) and an Austrian mother. His sister is an Austrian badminton player, Serena Au Yeong. This biographical article related to association football in Austria, about a midfielder, is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. This biographical article related to association football in Austria, about a forward, is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Daniel Au Yeong
